--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, =
"kwlux1" <kwlux1@...> wrote:
>
> I found the documentation on SourceForge w=
hich said that if you want 
> to use python to run cantera, just run the bi=
nary installer.
> 
> So I:
> 
> 1. Installed Python 2.5
> 2. Ran the canter=
a msi
> 3. Ran the cantera setup from the cantera folder
> 4. When I double=
-clicked on a python script a DOS console window 
> flashed on the screen (=
no error message)
> 5. If I right click on a script and then choose to edit=
 the script 
> and then try to run it from the python console:
>    ImportE=
rror: No module named numarray.libnumeric
> 6. The offending line in the sc=
ript is "import from Cantera *"
> 7. So I found the libnumeric installer fo=
r python 2.5 and installed 
> it.
> 8. Same problem.
> 9. Searched for answ=
ers in the forum, haven't found any (yet)
>

thon 2.5 and the cantera 1.7 msi and got 
> it to work? If so, how did you =
do it? The installation instructions

und answers for matlab, but I

(at least under winxp) so I 
> need to get the winxp installer working with=
 python.

umeric

=
> glance of the python directory structure.
